intro: Leucophysalis savatieri, commonly known as the golden wax plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that resemble wax or candle wax, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
